title: List of Brussels Metro stations
text:
This list of <a href="Brussels">Brussels</a> <a href="rapid%20transit">metro</a> and "<a href="Brussels%20premetro">premetro</a>" stations includes all the underground stations in the <a href="Brussels%20Metro">Brussels metro and "premetro" network</a>, arranged by line. The "premetro" refers to sections of the Brussels tramway network which run underground and at metro frequency.
Line 1.
<a href="Brussels%20Metro%20line%201">Line 1</a> replaces former Line 1B since 4 April 2009. Line 1 does not service though the stations between <a href="Erasme/Erasmus%20metro%20station">Erasme/Erasmus</a> and <a href="Jacques%20Brel%20metro%20station">Jacques Brel</a>, which are now serviced by Line 5.
Line 2.
Line 2 was expanded in April 2009 in order to connect the stations <a href="Delacroix%20metro%20station">Delacroix</a> and <a href="Brussels-West%20station">Gare de l'Ouest/Weststation</a>. In this way the line now forms a loop between starting and ending in the <a href="Simonis%20and%20Elisabeth%20stations">Simonis/Elisabeth station complex</a>, known as Simonis on its upper level and Elisabeth on its lower level. Most of this line (between <a href="Yser/IJzer%20metro%20station">Yser/IJzer</a> and <a href="Brussels-South%20railway%20station">Brussels-South railway station</a>) runs under the Brussels <a href="small%20ring%20%28Brussels%29">small ring</a>.
Line 5.
The Line 5 replaces the former Line 1A since 4 April 2009 between <a href="Herrmann-Debroux%20metro%20station">Herrmann-Debroux</a> and <a href="Beekkant%20metro%20station">Beekkant</a>. The section of former Line 1A between Beekkant and <a href="King%20Baudouin%20metro%20station">King Baudouin</a> is now serviced by Line 6. The section of Line 5 between Beekkant and <a href="Erasme/Erasmus%20metro%20station">Erasme/Erasmus</a> was formerly serviced by Line 1B.
Line 6.
Line 6 replaces the former Line 1A between <a href="Beekkant%20metro%20station">Beekkant</a> and <a href="King%20Baudouin%20metro%20station">King Baudouin</a> since 4 April 2009. It also runs under the Brussels <a href="small%20ring%20%28Brussels%29">small ring</a> as does Line 2.
North-South Axis.
The <a href="Brussels%20tram">Brussels tram</a> routes <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%203">3</a> and <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%204">4</a> use the <a href="North%E2%80%93South%20Axis%20%28Brussels%29">North-South Axis</a> and run on surface outside the city centre. The common section offers a high service frequency during daytime hours between Vanderkindere in the municipality of <a href="Uccle">Uccle</a> and the <a href="Brussels-North%20railway%20station">Brussels-North railway station</a>. It shares 4 connections with metro lines and also links two major train stations with access to <a href="Thalys">Thalys</a> and <a href="Eurostar">Eurostar</a> trains at <a href="Brussels-South%20railway%20station">Brussels-South railway station</a>.
Greater Ring Axis.
The Greater Ring Axis is an underground section under the <a href="Greater%20ring%20%28Brussels%29">greater ring of Brussels</a> used by tram routes <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%207">7</a>, and <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%2025">25</a>.
